poem:
**The Quiet Echo**

In the morning glow,  
headlines whisper,  
stories unfold like paper birds  
taking flight.  
  
Blake stands firm,  
her voice a river,  
cutting through silence  
like sunlight on a wall.  
  
Solidarity blooms,  
a murmured garden  
growing toward  
an unstained sky.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Blake Lively sees wide support in lawsuit against co-star Justin Baldoni Blake Lively is picking up broad support in her battle against her It Ends With Us co-star and director Justin Baldoni, days after the US actor filed a sexual harassment and retaliation complaint against him on Friday in what was rapidly becoming the most dynamic #MeToo event of the dying year. “Never change. Never wilt,” Colleen Hoover, author of the book that inspired and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
